<title level="1" right="Rules">[Nonlethal Attacks](/Rules.aspx?ID=2311)</title>

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 407 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
You can make a nonlethal attack to knock someone out instead of killing them (see [Knocked Out](/Rules.aspx?ID=2324) and [Dying](/Rules.aspx?ID=2325)). Weapons with the [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=661) trait (including [fists](/Weapons.aspx?ID=356)) do this automatically. You take a –2 circumstance penalty to the attack roll when you make a nonlethal attack using a weapon or unarmed attack that doesn’t have the nonlethal trait. You also take this penalty when making a lethal attack using a nonlethal weapon. Spells and other effects with the nonlethal trait that reduce a creature to 0 Hit Points knock the creature out instead of killing them.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
